attributes.action: Close Pentonville Prison
attributes.background: This prison is failing both inmates and the general public, and needs to be closed immediately.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/two-prisoners-escape-pentonville-prison-north-london-ministry-justice-a7402701.html

attributes.action: Restrict all heavy lorries with speed limiters to one lane on motorways.
attributes.background: As heavy vehicles are fitted with speed limiters, overtaking can take several miles and cause congestion and tailback to vehicles without speed restrictors.
attributes.additional_details: The effect is to cause congestion and tailbacks to other motorway users.

attributes.action: Increase public awareness and penalties for using mobiles whilst driving.
attributes.background: A mother and three young children were needlessly killed by a lorry driver using his phone recently. A massive  government information campaign is needed to help stamp this thoughtless practice out, also use of existing cameras for prosecutions and an instant twelve month ban for offenders as in DD.

attributes.action: Offer support mentally for citizens dealing with life changing disabilities
attributes.background: For example, many people in the UK suffer with a life limiting/ changing disability. Help as such as how to operate a wheelchair, how to tune cochlear implants etc is provided by the nhs. No help mentally is provided to help people adjust to their new lives.
attributes.additional_details: I know many people including myself who have suffered from a life changing disability. Obviously these disabilites have a major effect on our life and how we see it. Out of everyone i know, not one fraction of us was offered someone to talk to.

attributes.action: Agency workers need to be protected against unfair dismissal by law.
attributes.background: After being let go from an agency working position, I realised that agency workers have little to no rights or protection when it comes to unfair dismissal or even being able to have times off for emergencies (unlike their contracted counterparts).

attributes.action: Stop premium rate mobile phone service subscriptions without confirmatory text
attributes.background: Many mobile phone users have found themselves subscribed to premium rate services which are charged to their phone bills simply because they closed an unwanted pop up advert while browsing the internet. There is no cooling off period, and usually no confirmation text so bill payer is not aware!
attributes.additional_details: To stop the charges being levied unfairly there should be a 14 day cooling off period before any service charges, secondly, as many of these services don't send a confirmation text that a subscription has been set up the mobile phone user may not know. The law must be changed to stop these unfair subscriptions and charges.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Oxfordshire's membership of the European Union
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU Referendum Oxfordshire voted to stay in the EU 70% to 30% but now risk being dragged out of the EU like Scotland and having a vote on the membership is in no way subverting democracy
attributes.additional_details: Oxford is a city who's economy is reliant on the EU and dragging them out would be completely undemocratic

attributes.action: Disallow M.P.s working for firms who have successfully lobbied them as ministers
attributes.background: M.P.s should not profit from their time in office, consorting with firms who lobby them. offering jobs after they leave office, for being compliant with their requests.
attributes.additional_details: Too many M.P.s from the last government and the previous one who held high office went on after losing their seats to take up posts with the very people who had been lobbying them for lucrative  contracts. The health service, television,the eco industry to name a few. M.P.s should be in office to serve the people not feather their nests for the future.

attributes.action: Introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for zero hours contracts
attributes.background:
We call on the government to introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for hours worked above contract hours. This would set a higher minimum pay rate for zero hour/minimal hours contracts.

Hours worked above contracted hours the minimum pay rate must be at least 1.25 times the minimum wage.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this bill is to target employers who systemically provide employees with contracts for considerably fewer hours than they would normally be expected to work. The most extreme case of this is employers who widely use zero hours contracts.

In the example of a zero hours contract the minimum pay rate would be £9 per hour based on the current National Living Wage of £7.20. The same minimum rate would apply to other overtime.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT on Food & Drink in cafe's etc. to 10% & lower the threshold to £40K
attributes.background: Across Europe there are 14 member countries that charge VAT at 10% or less on food and drink served in pubs, cafes, restaurants etc. Some small businesses falsely declare lower turnovers to ensure they do not come into the VAT scope. Café A pays 20% VAT being honest, Café B pays 0 and avoid VAT.
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT is reduced to 10% this would have a positive effect on the economy and tourism. By lowering the threshold on the same you bring more businesses into scope which would benefit the treasury for the lost VAT income and reduce fraudulent under declaring of turnover closing a tax avoidance loophole. It would also mean that there was a level playing field for businesses to compete and encourage growth. The general public would receive better value and comparison if all on the same tax

attributes.action: Stop immigration medical surcharge Visa fees for people already living in UK
attributes.background: Why should people pay surcharge medical fee for those already living in Britain. Why migrants that already living and working here, paying tax and national insurance through their various employers from time to time pay for medical surcharge whenever they want to renew their visas.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to have scans (MRI/CT) BEFORE meds are prescribed.
attributes.background: Too many unfortunate people have been misdiagnosed and given a cocktail of drugs which may and in many and most cases worsen their possible/current mental health issues.
attributes.additional_details:
This will allow professionals to research different mental health issues and find out why these are apparent issues and other possible causes. This may seem useless and not cost effective, but what really matters?... Money? or the people who make it possible for a parliament to even exist/govern.
Ignorance to mental health is dangerous to society.

attributes.action: Calculate student loans by disposable income per person rather than by household
attributes.background: If a student comes from a family with 4 children and the income of their family is the same as a student who is an only child, they get the same in student loans, putting one at a disadvantage. These loans should be calculated using disposable income per person rather than household income overall
attributes.additional_details: Currently, a student's maintenance loans are worked out using the full household income in order to assess how much help they require from the government and how much of it their parents can subsidise. This is unfair as, even if the families have the same income, a family with four dependents will be able to subsidise less than a family with only one or two children as they have to make the money go further between people.

attributes.action: to cancel all foreign aid to North Korea and India
attributes.background: As our NHS struggles for funding,  we are still sending money to North Korea and India,  we need to put our own house in order first

attributes.action: House all 58,000 British/ Irish citizens that are Homeless
attributes.background: all citizens that are British or Irish citizens no economic migrants! Sleeping bags & people littering our streets is inexcusable. Let's take a wedge from the foreign aid budget and boot out foreign criminals after their custodial sentence finishes, and get rid of all illegals. No exceptions.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of affordable residences, along with government funding cuts and welfare restrictions, increases UK's homeless population by 6 percent over last year to 58,000 people.

attributes.action: Compel retailers to ensure that all product packaging covers recyclability
attributes.background: Recycling claims and labels are intended to provide consumers with information that will help them to sort their packaging correctly after use. However, there are still a significant number of packaging types that do not provide the necessary recyclability information required to aid consumers.
attributes.additional_details:
As consumers we have a collective responsibility to contribute to effective waste management strategies and ultimately to reduce our negative impact on the earth. This petition, if successful, is intended firstly to facilitate consumer decision-making and also, to highlight those brands/companies that are failing to contribute to the war on waste. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/2010-to-2015-government-policy-waste-and-recycling/2010-to-2015-government-policy-waste-and-recycling

attributes.action: Artificial grass should require planning permission due to the harm to wildlife
attributes.background: The results of a number of studies have suggested the harm to wildlife due to artificial grass could be huge. As such, planning permission should be required - just as it is required to restrict wildlife damage in property and commercial development.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/jul/04/growth-in-artificial-lawns-poses-threat-to-british-wildlife-conservationists-warn

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/earth/wildlife/11610170/Artificial-lawns-are-damaging-wildlife-say-conservation-charities.html

http://www.express.co.uk/life-style/garden/577455/Artificial-lawns-huge-threat-Britain-s-wildlife

https://goo.gl/cPzKkJ

https://goo.gl/uMe75y

https://goo.gl/2COF9Q

https://goo.gl/6kA4UP

attributes.action: As an opener to negotiations, send to the EU an invoice for £60B.
attributes.background:
The EU opening shot in negotiations seems to be that the UK owes a spurious €50B.
Why not use our demand as a counter negotiation ploy?

attributes.action: Allow people with monocular vision to hold a Group 2 category licence. C, C+E.
attributes.background: I would love to be a lorry driver but I can't because I am barred by law from holding a Group 2 category. This includes categories C, C+E, D, D+E etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I have perfectly good vision and field of view for the loss of my one eye, I have even passed my IAM advanced test for both car and motorbike. 
I think this is discrimination, because if I am able to pass my theory test, practical and medical I should be able to hold a Group 2 category.

I lost my right eye when I was two years old, I know no different and am a competent driver and educated in road safety. 
Unfortunately I can't pursue my dream because I am barred by law.

attributes.action: Fundamentally change the structure of the UK-HMRC Taxation System to a flat 15%
attributes.background: In light of Brexit, we need to start redefining our position Globally. We can easily improve the lives of working Britons and better support those in need, whilst encouraging corporate billions into our Country by introducing flat tax and by no longer punishing people for doing well.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/nov/02/institute-for-economic-affairs-report-abolish-20-taxes-income-tax-15-per-cent

Pure, unmitigated sense.

attributes.action: Cancel  HS2 & modernise the entire UK rail network, replacing the diesel fleet.
attributes.background:
Electrification of all UK rail infrastructure would allow diesel trains to be phased out. 
Electrification will reduce emissions in UK cities; huge diesel's run whilst sat in stations & emit whilst travelling. 
diesel stock doesn't have effective  emission control and emits NOx and particles.
attributes.additional_details:
Bidders on HS2 could be directed to modernise current rail networks by provision of dual lines & upgrading rolling stock to bring faster, cleaner, faster journeys and to make available to all UK citizens and not just few who may use the HS2 route.

Fast journeys are already possible on Pendolino trains, this should cover the current network before HS2.

Think of stations including Euston and Paddington with zero diesel fumes!

https://academic.oup.com/jnci/article-lookup/doi/10.1093/jnci/djs034

attributes.action: As of March 29th, all Parliamentary recesses should be cancelled.
attributes.background:
On March 29th Article 50 will be triggered. Parliament is set to recess on March 30th. 

Due to the time constraints on the UK government negotiating the UK's Brexit deal it seems appropriate to not spend quite so much of that period on holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
All Parliament's planned recesses should be abandoned.

Given the importance of the negotiations, it seems fair to assume that our Parliament is 100% committed to getting the job done. This seems unachievable if Parliament spends as much time as currently diarised on holiday and away from the task at hand.

The only way for MPs to show their commitment to we, the people, is to immediately state their intention to work wholeheartedly until the job is done.

attributes.action: Allow all Police Officers to carry a Taser for their own safety and the public.
attributes.background: After a recent attack on London, it is very important for our Police services to be equipped with methods of dealing with such incidents. As firearm weapons are not a possible solution, an alternative less lethal option is available, a Taser device.
attributes.additional_details: Equipping our Police Officers with such devices shall ensure that if a threat is real and occurring, it can be dealt with immediately. Currently, the Police have to request for firearms officers to attend or a Taser carrying officer if the situation is extreme. This delay can cause injury to the police officer as well as members of the public. With recent incidents, our police officers need to be able to cope with the change, they need to be protected and be able to protect. Equip officers!

attributes.action: Increase the number of Armed Forces to stand guard over areas of vulnerability.
attributes.background: After the terrorist attack on Westminster, I believe it is important to have more protection in our cities. If we employ more soldiers, we can have them stand guard in our cities for a faster response to threats. It could also ease pressure on the police force.

attributes.action: right to stay in your council/housing association home for life
attributes.background: The government is trying to introduce legislation to review all social housing tenants on need for their home. This needs stopping -  a home should be for life.  Please support.

attributes.action: Allow parents the right to remove children from sex and relationship education.
attributes.background: The Government will table an amendment to the Children and Social Work Bill that will make sex and relationship education (SRE) part of the national curriculum in schools compulsory for children as young as 4. Its proposed parents will not be allowed the right to withdraw their children.
attributes.additional_details: Education can shape a generation. Currently there is pressure on schools from lobby groups and some MPs to promote homosexuality and impose inappropriate sex education on younger children. There are also attempts to remove the freedom that parents currently have to withdraw their children from sex education. We believe that ultimate responsibility for educating children lies with the parents, not the State.

attributes.action: Permanently move both Houses of Parliament out of the 'Westminster Village'.
attributes.background: In view of modern communications technology, there is no reason for   Parliament and the bulk of the civil service to be concentrated in a small area which is both immensely expensive and isolated from the bulk of the electorate. Let both houses move to more suitable accommodation in other cities.
attributes.additional_details: Valuation Office Agency figures suggest that the average rateable value of office space in Manchester and Birmingham is 128 per metre^2, compared to 462 in Westminster. Many departments are already responding to this challenge by relocating offices out of London. Parliament should follow suit, acquiring better equipped modern premises in provincial cities, which, beside the savings to the taxpayer, would help to remove MPs and Peers from the isolated "village" in which they work at present.

attributes.action: Make the glamorous promotion and unavoidable shop displays of alcohol illegal.
attributes.background: Alcohol is promoted on tv in every ad break, its at the entrance of every supermarket and at the end of every aisle! In the summer the ads and supermarkets tell you its not summer without a beer, you can't enjoy a bbq or dinner party without wine, that wine makes you better company around friends!!
attributes.additional_details: Im not saying ban it! But lets stick it in a separate section in the supermarket that is out of sight and not the first thing you see as you walk in!! Don't glamourise it in front of our kids but don't make it a forbidden fruit either!! Keep it out of the local all night stores and remove the ads that glamourise it from our tv, magazines and billboards! Lets have some balance, some honesty, some education please!! We all know where the alcohol is and if we want it, we know where we can buy it!!

attributes.action: New EU referendum if talks fail
attributes.background: There is a high risk that EU negotiations could breakdown and or that a complex trade agreement cannot be secured within two years. Given the economic implications of this, the Government must seek a new mandate from the people before making a decision that will affect us for decades to come.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2017 Parliament's Foreign Affairs Committee published a report on the implications of the UK not securing a deal with the EU within two years of triggering Article 50.  

Chair of the Committee, Crispin Blunt MP, said: 

"The possibility of 'no deal' is real enough to require the Government to plan how to deal with it. But there is no evidence to indicate that this is receiving the consideration it deserves or that serious contingency planning is underway."

http://bit.ly/2mf3QUV

attributes.action: Cut overseas aid from over £12bn a year to £1bn a year
attributes.background: Nhs,education,benefits,schools community programs are in the news every day telling us they don't have enough money .Let people give money to the charities they support and not be dictated to by the government.We have a rich history of giving to charities but it's time to put our citizens first.

attributes.action: Parliament to review Credit agency unfair rules.
attributes.background:
Credit agencies have set rules which can be unfair and damaging to many a young person, punishments can often be more harsh than court rulings,  also trying to sort out a problem is very difficult due to conflict ions between credit companies, and information providers,  
i give one example below.
attributes.additional_details:
Eg,
in 2012 i was ill and fell behind 3 month mortgage payments,on a second property, i sold the house paying off my missed payments in the sale, yet i was put on a delinquent list, this is now on for 6 years, this is ridiculous. the same would apply to a your post grad who made teenage mistakes, and now may have to wait 6 important years of his life to fix.
there are no ways to resolve these problems early, even criminals in jail can get time off for good behaviour, please review the rules.

attributes.action: End the inequality and offer fathers the same paternity leave as mothers.
attributes.background:
Women in the UK are entitled to paid maternity leave up to 39 weeks. 

Men only get 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
To deny fathers the same benefit is unfair, unequal and sexist, the father should be available to help the mother of a new born child, a very difficult time for many families. For up to 39 weeks with pay as women are. 
Many women who have C sections or difficult births require extra care, especially if they already have an older child. 
2 weeks leave is not suitable or long enough to allow a father to bond with a new baby and to aid the recovery of his partner after child birth/C section.

attributes.action: Provide funding for external wall insulation for homes
attributes.background: Similar to recent schemes for funding of cavity wall insulation, we'd like funding for external wall insulation for homes that aren't suitable for cavity wall insulation, such as solid wall, Stone and concrete homes.
attributes.additional_details:
Live in a concrete house myself which is unsuitable for cavity wall funding. During winter we find it too unbearable with no heating on, for example waking up with frozen finger tips, toes and noses. Due to central heating costing too much as heat is lost through the walls and takes too long to heat the house up, we can't afford to have the heating on very long.

External wall insulation is too expensive for home owners to fund themselves, having been quoted around £15k for a 3 bed semi myself

attributes.action: Make spice a class A drug
attributes.background: We all need to come together and stop this. The nhs is under enough pressure as it. So please sign this and lets make the world a better place to live.
attributes.additional_details: I'm starting a petition about spice and illegal highs, now at one time they was legal, now they are not legal. I have noticed an increase of homeless people in Manchester City centre, smoking spice and not knowing what to do afterwards. The worst case can cause death.  Now I'm no drug expert, but these drugs should not be allowed on our streets. Especially where elderly people, kids really all types of different lifestyles & all ages are. So please help my petition come into action.

attributes.action: Lower insurance premiums for 17- 25 year olds.<£1500
attributes.background: Earning minimum wage and cannot afford such a high insurance premium on such a low wage. Something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Start banning people with 12 or driving points as they keep getting more
attributes.background: Highway code states that anyone who gets 12 points or more MAY be banned. Why may when they have committed the crime more than once
attributes.additional_details:
New drivers in the first 2 years getting 6 points or more will lose their licence so why not driver who have more than 2 years
 I call this discrimination against new drivers and letting others get away with breaking the law

attributes.action: DNA testing dogs to trace owners whose dogs defecate in public areas.
attributes.background: Dog fouling so called is an act that many many people are incensed about and occurs because owners will not take responsibility for it. Playing fields, sports fields, pavements,  bear the brunt of the sheer unpleasantness of this avoidable form of litter, which after all, is a crime.

attributes.action: Remove the statue of Oliver Cromwell outside Parliament.
attributes.background:
Although he made change for the good, he still became a ruthless dictator. Why should the following be welcomed by parliament:
Killing over 250,000 people whilst conquering Ireland, which Cromwell justified as the "righteous judgment of God upon these barbarous wretches".
attributes.additional_details: He enforced his rule using the military, with the governors who ruled England under him ex-military generals who were extremely brutal. Although Christianity or being a Puritan isn't a defined good or bad trait, he forced all to follow his religion, forcing fasts, banning any form of work on Sunday and banning any fun, like Christmas or work.

attributes.action: 21st Century Britain Needs a Written Constitution
attributes.background: Post Brexit Multicultural UK needs a written constitution. Democracy is fragile, the citizens of the country are responsible to safe guard it. A written constitution will empower them to be the watch dogs of democracy. This will ultimately make the majority accommodate and the minority reassured.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop foreign companies taking over British successful companies
attributes.background: Over the last 30 years, many of Britain’s successful and well known companies have been taking over by foreign companies, only to be broken up or their factories moved aboard. This new law would stop this practice if it was considered not be in the national interest.

attributes.action: Ask Mr Trump to conduct his visit virtually and use money saved to support NHS
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government, in the interest of economy, respectfully request that president Donald Trump, given his preference and aptitude for social media, conduct his visit virtually by electronic means and that the monies saved should be used immediately to support the National Health Service.

attributes.action: Make first aid training courses free
attributes.background: There is no price on life. Children should be taught first aid in school. Adults should be taught first aid at work. We should be able to act automatically when someone is in need of life-saving aid.

attributes.action: Our schools are struggling due to funding cuts. Redirect foreign aid to schools
attributes.background: Our schools are struggling http://m.bristolpost.co.uk/olympus-headteacher-asks-parents-for-donations-as-budget-cuts-drive-schools-to-crisis-point/story-30155492-detail/story.html We are paying vast amounts to countries such as India who state they have not requested or need. Redirect to schools
attributes.additional_details: Schools are discussing four day weeks, increased class sizes and parent contributions as they struggle to afford to educate children in state schools due to increasing pupil numbers. It is the children of the less affluent in society those who cannot afford private education who will suffer making the divide between rich and poor educated even wider. Although it is commendable to help other countries it should not be at the expense of our children's future and their education

attributes.action: Insist the US provides explanation as to why J. Miah was denied entry to the US.
attributes.background: Juhel Miah was denied entry to the US based on nothing tangible. Seemingly the reason doesn't even link to the disproportionate and now illegal travel ban enforced by Donald Trump's administration.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Foreign Office has even stated that no one with a British passport will be denied entry to the US - so why?

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to start driving lessons.
attributes.background: Lower the legal age to start driving lessons to 16. This will allow teens to start driving and prepare people to start driving once they are 17. A friend of mine started driving lessons at 17 and only got his license at 23 years of age. The struggle is real.

attributes.action: Students to have over an hour and a half of Physical Education a week
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that students have to have over an hour and a half of physical education per week.

attributes.action: Introduce knowledge on diversity and the LGBT+ to the primary school curriculum
attributes.background: If children are introduced to diversity and the lgbt+ community from a young age this could prevent racism and homophobia. Hate is taught not inate.
attributes.additional_details: Every single person i have encountered who support discrimination were either taught to do so or were only introduced to it via insults (e.g "that's so gay") however those of us who do not, tend to have been shown that skin colour or sexual orientation does not define a person. teaching young children about these topics and people can help them understand that everyone is different and nobody should never be ashamed of who they are.

attributes.action: Reduce alcohol duty. High duty disproportionately penalises the poor.
attributes.background: Higher prices do not prevent alcoholism. Reducing duties to a level similar to Belgium will allow, responsible, poorer drinkers to enjoy better quality drinks without having to sacrifice other things.

attributes.action: Eliminate higher rate stamp duty for small developers restoring  old properties
attributes.background: Currently buying and restoring an unihabitable Victorian house previously owned by elderly people who did not look after it. Will then sell it as an updated habitable property. Would pay stamp duty anyway as well as vat on costs of restoring and tax on completion. Higher rate sdlt too much.
attributes.additional_details: Higher rate stamp duty is an unnecessary tax preventing developers updating and restoring homes. Can make the process unviable. We will end up having derelict properties dotted around our towns and cities which could be homes.

attributes.action: Stop sanctions for Jobseekers of 4 weeks or more
attributes.background: People would have no money for food, heating, electricity, clothes and toiletries and risk becoming homeless.  The claimant commitments are too unrealistic and not everyone has access to computers for Universal jobmatch every day or skills needed.
attributes.additional_details:
JSA is only £72 per week and some people must pay Council tax and housing out of this.
Job centre work coaches are getting stressed about issue as they are on the front line and must implement this cruel sanctioning.  Some leave due to a conscience.
